alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 9:54AM PST until February 20 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches possible. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascades, especially above 3000 feet. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow may make travel very difficult at times this weekend, even across passes such as Highway 26 near Government Camp and Highway 20 at Santiam Pass. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will start near 4000 feet Saturday afternoon, lowering to around 2000 feet by Sunday morning. Snow levels will fall further as precipitation tapers off Sunday evening.
info.instruction: There is a potential for significant snow or ice accumulations. Future driving and walking conditions may become hazardous, so it is important to monitor the latest forecasts.
